senses.de: To remove or dispose of something.
senses.ex: If the milk smells bad, then throw it out.

Tips.title: Physical Disposal
Tips.description: Use 'throw out' when talking about physically putting something in the trash.
Tips.example: I need to throw out these wilted flowers.

Tips.title: Metaphorically Remove
Tips.description: It can be used metaphorically to suggest ending or discarding an idea.
Tips.example: Let's throw out our current plans and make new ones.

senses.de: To remove someone from a place or event.
senses.ex: He was thrown out of the club for bad behavior.

Tips.title: Forceful Removal
Tips.description: Implies someone was removed against their will, often due to a rule violation.
Tips.example: She was thrown out for sneaking in snacks.

Tips.title: Location Specific
Tips.description: Often used with locations, indicating where the person is removed from.
Tips.example: He got thrown out of class for talking too much.

senses.de: To propose or suggest an idea or plan for consideration.
senses.ex: Let's throw out our old strategy and start afresh.

Tips.title: Idea Introduction
Tips.description: Suggests offering an idea casually, not always formally prepared.
Tips.example: I'll throw out a couple of names for our project.

Tips.title: Start Discussion
Tips.description: Can indicate the start of a discussion or brainstorming session.
Tips.example: She threw out a few ideas to discuss.

senses.de: To cause a fact or calculation to be inaccurate.
senses.ex: Those outliers are throwing out our statistical data.

Tips.title: Accuracy Impact
Tips.description: Indicates something that causes data or results to be incorrect or unreliable.
Tips.example: An error in the experiment threw out the results.

Tips.title: Scientific Context
Tips.description: Most commonly used in scientific or statistical settings for this meaning.
Tips.example: The outlier measurements were throwing out our averages.

senses.de: To physically move body parts in an exaggerated or careless manner.
senses.ex: She threw out her arms in surprise.

Tips.title: Expressive Gestures
Tips.description: Describes a sudden and often impulsive bodily movement to show feeling.
Tips.example: He threw out his hands in frustration.

Tips.title: Unintentional Action
Tips.description: Sometimes implies an unintentional or reflexive movement.
Tips.example: In fright, she threw out her arms to protect herself.
